page.title: 06GOVERNMENT
page.content: A NEW TOWN IS ONE IN WHICH IN ESSENCE HAS BEEN PLANNED AND NOT ALLOWED TO DEVELOP HAPHAZARDLY. THE OBJECTIVE WAS TO PROVIDE FAMILIES WITH NOT ONLY A HOME BUT ALSO A PLACE OF EMPLOYMENT, AND AMENITIES FOR EDUCATION AND RECREATION. THE BOUNDARIES OF THE NEW TOWN WERE DRAWN UP IN 1949, AND THE FIRST HOUSE WERE COMPLETED IN 1951. THE TOWN WAS BUILT IN 'LOCAL NEIGHBOURHOODS, WHICH WAS A SELFCONTAINED UNIT, WITH SHOPS, SCHOOL, PUBLIC HOUSE, COMMUNITY HALL, CHURCH ETC. ORIGINALLY, NINE SUCH NEIGHBOURHOODS WERE PLANNED, BUT IT NOW SEEMS THAT THERE ARE LIKELY TO BE ABOUT TWENTY.
